titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States providing for the recall of Senators and Representatives.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

bill.summary: 2/16/1993--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits a Member of Congress from serving the remainder of his or her term if the Member has been recalled from such office. Authorizes a qualified voter of a State to register a petition with the executive authority of such State requesting the recall of a Member of Congress. Establishes procedures for registering and processing such a petition and for the recall of a Member of Congress.
